stories.text:
I'm not sure if this is the right place to ask, but I can't figure out what could technically cause what just happened, and I thought you might know.

A few days ago I noticed something strange, the netflix account my friend was sharing with me started showing up in Spanish, I didn't think much of it. Now I started getting really confused when my youtube subtitles had now also switched to Spanish as well, despite my youtube account language and location being set to an other country.

Note that I tried on both firefox and chrome and got spanish default in both cases.

Also note that I don't use a VPN.

- I looked at my browsers language, it's set to English

- Tried on private tab, same result

- Checked my OS language / timezone, nothing about Spain here

- Checked my google account language / timezone, all set in my language

- Checked my google account connections, nothing weird showing up here either, all showing as connections from my country by my devices

I simply cannot make sense of this, and that's what made me want to post here. How could both the netflix account of my friend, as well as my youtube subtitles start defaulting to Spanish given all the above points I mentioned?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why default language is mysteriously changing on online services?
